H0.text: Glycolysis is the first stage of cellular respiration.

H1.text: Electrolysis is the first stage of cellular respiration.

H2.text: Hydrolisis is the first stage of cellular respiration.

H3.text: Metabolism is the first stage of cellular respiration.

A4.text: Glycolysis is the metabolic pathway that converts glucose (C6H12O6) into pyruvate and, in most organisms, occurs in the liquid part of cells (the cytosol).

A5.text: The citric acid cycle (or Krebs Cycle) follows glycolysis, where the acetyl group of the acetyl-CoA is converted into carbon dioxide by two decarboxylation reactions.
